rcomplex 0.1.0
  • Reference

Find co-expression cliques from a multi-species edge list

Source: R/cliques.R
find_coexpression_cliques.Rd

For each Hierarchical Ortholog Group (HOG), builds an undirected graph from qualifying edges and uses igraph::cliques() to find fully connected subgraphs containing exactly one gene per target species.

find_coexpression_cliques(edges, target_species, edge_type = "conserved")

Arguments

edges

Data frame with columns:

gene1

Gene identifier (first gene in pair)

gene2

Gene identifier (second gene in pair)

species1

Species abbreviation for gene1

species2

Species abbreviation for gene2

hog

Ortholog group identifier

type

Edge classification (e.g. "conserved", "diverged", "n.s.")

effect_size

Numeric effect size for the edge

target_species

Character vector of species abbreviations that must each contribute exactly one gene to each clique (e.g. c("BDIS", "HVUL", "VBRO")).

edge_type

Character string specifying which edge type(s) qualify for clique membership (default "conserved"). Only edges with type %in% edge_type are used.

Value

A data frame with one row per clique, containing columns:

hog

Ortholog group identifier

One column per target species with the gene ID

min_effect_size

Minimum effect size across all edges in the clique

mean_effect_size

Mean effect size across all edges in the clique

Returns a zero-row data frame with correct columns if no cliques are found.
